meta.title: Ana Rose
meta.description: A cohesive brand identity, website, and seamless online booking system designed to help this Dallas cleaning service grow its residential and commercial client base.

project.title: Brief
project.description: Ana Rose is a Dallas-based cleaning service brand founded by a solo entrepreneur looking to grow beyond word-of-mouth referrals. Originally focused on small residential cleanings, Ana Rose aimed to elevate its brand, streamline operations, and expand into larger residential projects and commercial contracts. I partnered with the founder to design a cohesive brand identity, build a modern website, and develop an online booking experience tailored to her target clientele.
project.goals:
•	Refresh the brand to feel professional, trustworthy, and scalable
•	Launch a website with built-in scheduling and quote requests
•	Support expansion into higher-value residential and commercial markets
project.challenges:
•	No existing brand identity or web presence
•	Manual scheduling limited growth and responsiveness
•	Needed to appeal to both home and business clients
project.solutions:
•	Designed a clean, modern logo and visual system
•	Built a responsive website with online booking and service breakdowns
•	Crafted messaging and design that bridges residential warmth with commercial credibility

project.title: Web Application (How-To-Guide)
project.description: A simple step-by-step guide that helps users easily navigate and book Ana Rose’s cleaning services online.

project.title: Web Application (Service-Description)
project.description: An overview of Ana Rose’s residential and commercial cleaning services with clear, client-focused descriptions.

project.title: Web Application (Custom-Services)
project.description: A customizable service builder that lets users tailor cleaning packages to their specific home or business needs.

project.title: Web Application (Testimonials)
project.description: A collection of real client testimonials that showcase trust, satisfaction, and proven cleaning results.

meta.title: Queendom Farms
meta.description: A strong visual brand and logo system created to authentically represent this women-led urban farm’s mission and audience.

project.title: Brief
project.description: Queendom Farms is an urban flower and fruit farm based in Georgia, aiming to establish itself in an industry traditionally dominated by men. Founded by two women inspired and empowered by agriculture, they set out to create a strong and authentic brand identity of their own
project.goals:
•	Establish a bold, authentic brand rooted in empowerment and agriculture
•	Differentiate Queendom in a male-dominated farming industry
•	Create a visual identity that reflects both strength and natural beauty
project.challenges:
•	Entering a competitive space with limited existing brand recognition
•	Balancing femininity and authority in a traditionally rugged market
•	Communicating values of sustainability, empowerment, and quality in a cohesive way
project.solutions:
•	Developed a confident and earthy visual identity that honors both founders’ spirit and the land
•	Crafted brand language that celebrates women in agriculture without relying on stereotypes
•	Built a brand system that’s flexible across packaging, signage, digital, and farmers market presence

project.title: Moodboard
project.description:
A visual collage capturing the brand’s essence—rooted in nature, empowerment, and modern femininity.

—

This moodboard set the foundation for Queendom Farms’ visual identity, blending organic textures, modern femininity, and themes of growth to visually align with the brand’s mission.

project.title: User Persona
project.description:
A detailed profile outlining the brand’s target audience, needs, values, and buying behaviors.

—

Developed through audience research, this persona defines key motivations, lifestyle choices, and purchasing habit. This ensures that the brand resonates authentically with its core audience.

project.title: User Persona
project.description:
A visual representation of Queendom Farms' ideal customer, crafted to guide brand decisions.

—

A composite visual of Queendom Farms’ ideal customer, helping guide tone, aesthetic, and messaging decisions from brand voice to UX flow.

project.title: Sketch & Prototypes
project.description:
Early logo sketches and digital prototypes exploring symbolism, balance, and brand voice.

—

With the initial sketches I wanted to explore symbols of strength and cultivation that evolved into digital prototypes that required being tested for its ingenuity, uniqueness, and scalability across real-world applications.

project.title: Logo Concept
project.description:
The official Queendom Farms logo—a bold, elegant mark reflecting strength and authenticity.

—

The final logo balances regal strength with organic elegance—capturing Queendom Farms’ essence as a bold, women-led agricultural brand.

project.title: Logo Formats
project.description:
Multiple logo file types and layouts for flexible use across packaging, web, and print.

—

Designed for versatility, logo assets were delivered in various formats to ensure consistency across digital, print, and product-based branding.

project.title: TypeFace
project.description:
A custom font pairing chosen for legibility and style, reinforcing the brand’s grounded tone.

—

This clean yet grounded font pairing was selected for readability and warmth—supporting brand storytelling across packaging, signage, and digital platforms.

project.title: Colors
project.description:
A warm, earthy color palette inspired by organic growth, soil, and harvest seasons.

—

An earthy, seasonal palette communicates authenticity and sustainability while enhancing recognition and emotional resonance with the target audience.

project.title: Logo Variations
project.description:
Alternate logo versions optimized for light, dark, small-scale, and vertical applications.

—

Each variation ensures brand consistency across all environments—whether on small-scale tags, dark-mode websites, or vertical packaging.

project.title: Moodboard
project.description:
An extended brand moodboard showing lifestyle inspiration, textures, and tone.

—

This extended board reinforces the brand’s visual direction, drawing from real textures, natural settings, and lifestyle cues to support design decisions.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Real-world mockups of the Queendom Farms brand across packaging, merchandise, and social media.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Real-world mockups of the Queendom Farms brand across packaging, merchandise, and social media.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Real-world mockups of the Queendom Farms brand across packaging, merchandise, and social media.

meta.title: Epic Future
meta.description: A versatile entertainment brand developed with culturally inspired logos and apparel designs, establishing a bold presence across key U.S. cities.

project.title: Brief
project.description: Epic Future was born from a vision: to create a bold entertainment brand that could live beyond the stage—on apparel, in culture, and in city streets. Founded by a Haitian-born creative, the brand needed to feel global, yet deeply personal.
project.goals:
•	Create a brand fit for apparel, jewelry, and media
•	Design a bold “EFE” submark for lifestyle use
•	Reflect Haitian heritage through color
•	Localize visuals for LA, ATL, and NYC
project.challenges:
•	Balancing streetwear and luxury in one mark
•	Honoring culture without clichés
•	Keeping city visuals distinct but unified
project.solutions:
•	Built a dual-logo system: Epic Future + EFE
•	Used a modernized Haitian color palette
•	Designed landmark-based EFE visuals per city
•	Delivered a flexible, cross-market brand system

project.title: Logo Variant (Full)
project.description: Clean black and white versions of the Epic Future logo showcasing its versatility across digital and physical formats.

project.title: Logo Variant (City-Collab)
project.description: Masked logo variants featuring iconic city landmarks to localize the Epic Future brand in key cultural hubs.

project.title: Logo Variant (Acronym)
project.description: A dynamic EFE emblem using masked letterforms from each city variant and colored with the Haitian flag to honor heritage.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Branded t-shirt mockups displaying the Epic Future and EFE logos in fashion-forward streetwear contexts.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Video preview of a model wearing an EFE-marked hoodie, highlighting logo impact in motion and lifestyle branding.

meta.title: Consolidated Construction
meta.description: A professional corporate brand package and user-friendly website delivered to position this Houston construction firm for growth in residential and commercial markets.

project.title: Brief
project.description: Consolidated Construction Solutions is a Houston-based, family-driven firm offering architectural and construction services across both residential and commercial markets. Built on trust, craftsmanship, and professionalism, the brand needed a refined identity and online presence to reflect its values and support future growth.
project.goals:
•	Build a clean, trustworthy brand for residential and commercial clients
•	Launch a website with scheduling, quote generation, and project showcase
•	Create branded materials for on-site, digital, and social visibility
project.challenges:
•	Balance a professional tone with family-oriented values
•	Appeal to a broad audience—from homeowners to commercial developers
•	Deliver a full brand system within a limited timeline and budget
project.solutions:
•	Designed a refined identity using warm, business-class color tones
•	Developed a responsive website with key client-facing features
•	Delivered a full branding package: stationery, apparel, magnets, and social templates

project.title: Moodboard
project.description: A visual direction board reflecting the brand’s clean, professional aesthetic and construction industry roots.

project.title: Logo Formats
project.description: Primary and alternate logo formats built for flexibility across digital, signage, and print applications.

project.title: Company Colors & Typeface
project.description: A business-forward color palette and sturdy typeface selected to convey trust, structure, and professionalism.

project.title: Stationery Kit
project.description: Branded stationery designs including letterhead, business cards, and job-site documents for a unified identity.

project.title: Brand Application
project.description: Mockups showcasing the logo applied to work shirts, company gear, and banners.

project.title: Web Application
project.description: A user-friendly website concept with scheduling, quote generation, and project showcase features.

meta.title: Perfectly Different
meta.description: An inclusive dating app concept designed with user research, personas, and UI prototypes to serve individuals with disabilities authentically and effectively.

project.title: Brief
project.description: Perfectly Different is a dating app concept built for people with disabilities—created to foster real, human connection in a digital world often shaped by superficial standards. What started as a friend’s idea grew into a passion project focused on inclusion, empathy, and authentic interaction.
project.goals:
•	Create a safe, inclusive space for people with disabilities to connect
•	Build awareness through media and storytelling
•	Monetize through sponsorships instead of user fees
project.challenges:
•	Marketing to an audience often overlooked or misrepresented
•	Designing a dating experience free from vanity-based interactions
•	Balancing accessibility, usability, and emotional sensitivity
project.solutions:
•	Conducted 1-on-1 interviews to define user needs and experiences
•	Mapped requirements, business goals, and user personas
•	Designed a UI prototype centered on meaningful, accessible interaction

project.title: Moodboard
project.description: A visual foundation capturing the inclusive, empowering, and human-centered spirit of the brand.

project.title: Business Requirements
project.description: Key structural and functional goals defined to support app development and user safety.

project.title: Business Needs
project.description: Core business objectives driving product design, marketing, and community engagement.

project.title: Business Voice, Tone, & Personality
project.description: A brand voice developed to be empathetic, honest, and confidently inclusive.

project.title: User Research
project.description: Direct insights from real people with disabilities to inform product features and emotional design.

project.title: User Needs
project.description: A concise list of user goals, pain points, and accessibility priorities that shaped the experience.

project.title: User Persona
project.description: A representative profile that reflects the motivations and daily challenges of a female user.

project.title: User Persona
project.description: A detailed persona illustrating the emotional and functional needs of a male user.

project.title: Success Metrics
project.description: Scenario-based prompts designed to explore how we might solve our technical goals and track its success in real-time.

project.title: Competitive Analysis
project.description: An evaluation of existing dating apps to identify market gaps and inclusive opportunities.

project.title: Concept Application
project.description: Initial UI concepts for onboarding and homepage experiences across platforms.

project.title: Concept Application
project.description: Interactive screens highlighting accessible UX and user-friendly dating interactions.

project.title: Concept Application
project.description: Additional layouts showcasing how inclusivity is embedded in every design detail.

project.title: Concept Application (Visual SiteMap)
project.description: A top-down view of the app’s architecture to visualize user flow and functionality.
